Dating: 26TH DYNASTY (not after); 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not before)
Name: Fragment of a shabti of the priest Pedamenope
Description: The fragment consists of the legs of a mummiform shabti, approximately from the hips downward; the feet and part of the right leg are missing. The arms were probably crossed, but specifications of the wig and the presence of tools cannot be given. The object has been polished smooth and the hieroglyphs are finely carved. Seven lines of text are preserved, running horizontally around the legs. The beginnings and endigs of each line are separated on the back by a double vertical line.
